block.field: All Thymios should operate in a space of at least 140x140 cm Environment
The surface shall be smooth, flat, and free from any unnecessary obstacles
All The 5 two-ways road must be represented by a black line.
The SoS shall be composed of 5 Thymios
At SoS starts, the Thymios shall be positioned at every entry road must be occupied by one thymio
At the beginning of every entry road must be occupied by one thymio
The SoS target shall be when all Thymios reach their respective destinations without any collision and error
The execution shall complete when all thymios reach their destination
Each Thymio shall have hardcoded the following information: Unique identifier, Group information, Sensor and actuator configurations, path, position, destination,
Thymio must be able to estimate the distance from other Thymio from the environment with the help of 5 front Proximity sensor
Thymio must be able to estimate the relative distance from the wall of the environment with the help of 2 back Proximity sensors
Each Thymio must be able to reach its destination without collision and violation of regulation
Each state of the thymio must show different colours the thymio
Thymio may operate in one of at least six states. i.e Forward, Reverse, left, right, stop, finished and sleep
Thymio should receive a signal to start
A Thymio shall operate to a black line
Each Thymio must detect other obstacles using RUPI
All thymios must receive start command from SOS using RUMI before moving
Each Thymio must exchange priority using RUMI
All thymios must be able to receive stop command from SOS using RUMI in an emergency situation
All CS should be available and responsive at all times during its operation.
Thymio should be able to recover from any failure quickly and resume its operation
Thymio should be able to reroute if, on the wrong path,
The communication between each Thymio and with SOS must be reliable
The system should be able to detect and handle any errors or failures that may occur in the Thymios' sensors, actuators, or communication modules.
The system should ensure the accuracy and consistency of the data used for routing, obstacle detection, and emergency response.
The system must protect against any unauthorized access or modification of the system's data or functionality
The Aseba switch must be protected against any unauthorized access or modification of the system's data or functionality
The Thymios should be able to detect any potential obstacles in their environment and take appropriate actions to avoid them.
The system should ensure that the Thymios follow their pre-planned route without colliding with each other or walls.
The Thymios should be able to respond to emergency situations, such as sudden stops or swerving, to prevent accidents and injuries.
A thymio moving on the wrong path may be able to reroute on correct path
Thymio must be able to react to each other's proximity to avoid collisions while following their planned routes
Thymio must authenticate itself before joining the network
All communication between the Thymio robots and the control system must be encrypted to prevent unauthorized access or interception of sensitive information
The Thymio robots must store their sensitive information, such as their unique identifier and authentication tokens, in a secure and encrypted manner.
Thymios shall measure time according to a local clock, whose resolution is the kilotick (1/32 of second)
Must have a shared reference clock to synchronize the local clocks of all Thymios.
